answers.answer: Hi, Diastolic dysfunction and diastolic heart failure occur when the heart's ventricles become too stiff, leading to impaired filling of the ventricles. The commonest cause for diastolic dysfunction is hypertension. Correcting this will help with the heart failure. Others are due to coronary artery disease, cardiomyopathy, aortic stenosis and diabetes. Supplements may not help improve this. Regards.

question: Hi,Would anyone know if there are dietary supplements for diastolic heart failure?(with normal ejection fraction) Would omega 3 supplements or powders like Ensure benefit?Thanks
title: diastolic heart failure
